intro: Cracca onobrychoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf burrweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces distinctive pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Cracca onobrychoides is adapted to arid environments and is relatively drought-tolerant.
